lines.text: You should have William Powell for a secretary.
William Powell... who's he?
Don't ya ever go to the movies? He's a detective, in "The Thin Man."
The enjoyment of art is the only remaining ecstasy that is neither immoral nor illegal.
Lovers of beauty never haggle over price, Tony.
I'll be at the Cathcart galleries absorbing culture. I don't want to die ignorant.
I've never been followed before.
That's a terrible reflection on American manhood.
You know, I think I'll fire you and get me a Tahitian secretary.
You won't like them; those grass skirts are a fire hazard.

[replying to Anthony Jardine]
You, on the level. Why, for six bits you'd hang your mother on a meathook.
How I detest the dawn. The grass always looks like it's been left out all night.
There goes my last lead. I feel all dead inside. I'm backed up in a dark corner, and I don't know who's hitting me.
I'm clean as a peeled egg. No debts, no angry husbands, no payoffs... nothin'.
I can be framed easier than "Whistler's Mother".
One thing led to another, and he led with his right.

[whispering]
Tell him you need two hundred dollars to leave town.

[on the phone to Galt]
I need two yards, powder money.
Isn't my Turner divine? Look at it! It grows on you.
You make it sound like a species of fungus.
I found the portrait long before I met Mari. And I worshipped it. When I did meet her, it was as if I'd always known her... and wanted her.
Oh, how romantic.
If you prefer to be maudlin about it, perhaps.
This is one of Donatello's finest pieces.
How much is it?
Wrap it up.
Hey, Mac. Do you suppose anybody in his right mind ever buys a piece of junk like that?
Sure they do. That is "aht."
It didn't work. It was a busto-crusto.
Take, uh, Tony for instance. I'd never imagine him to be interested in... Lucy Wilding, but he is.
It's not true! He's always loathed her.
He loathed her rather intimately, I'm afraid.
My father was a major-league umpire. Well, what else
[at the Tudor Penny Arcade]
can I beat you at?
What other kinds of games do you like to play? You know, we've got some great playgrounds up around 52nd Street.
Among them your apartment?
Why, just a coincidence.
I haven't worked for you very long, Mr. Galt, but I know when you're pitching a curve at me, and I always carry a catcher's mitt.
No offense. A guy's got to score, doesn't he?
Not in my league. I don't play for score, I play for keeps - "said she with a smile."
Why don't you come over here, where you belong?
[Bradford pats the couch that he is laying on]

[Kathleen throws Bradford his mended suit jacket and proceeds to walk out Bradford's front door]
Well, if you're feeling that much better, perhaps I better go home.
[scene fades]
What's done to you is done to me.
It didn't work. It was a busto crusto.

[Cathcart is at a total loss as to what this means]
A what?
A flop.
But remember, I can get brand new tough guys for a dime a dozen.
Here, get yourself two dozen.
[Bradford tosses two dimes at Kathleen across the table]

[Kathleen pushes them back towards Bradford]
I'd rather pick you up at a rummage sale. I'm a sucker for bargains. Speaking of bargains, if you can't get nines in those nylons, I'll take eight-and-a-half or even ten. Doesn't matter.
I'll make a note of it.
The stain... The ink, baby, the ink. I smeared ink on his white suit up in my office.
What of it?
He'd have to have the suit cleaned, wouldn't he? The cleaners would have his address, wouldn't they?
Well, this is a pretty dirty town. Cleaning places grow on every street like mushrooms.
Yeah, but they don't do their own cleaning.

Love is not the exclusive province of adolescence, my dear; it's a heart ailment that strikes all age groups-like my love for you. My love for you is the only malady I've contracted since the usual childhood diseases. And it's incurable.
